title: The Nazi Email Method
subject: The "Nazi" method of writing emails
author: Ben Settle
body:
This'll probably piss some people off.

But it's true:

The Nazis were masters of propaganda.

Evil? Yes.

Effective? Also yes.

And one of their chief propaganda techniques was something called "The Big Lie."

The idea?

Tell a lie so big, so audacious, that people assume it must be true.

Because who would have the balls to lie THAT big?

Now here's where this gets interesting for email:

Most marketers lie small.

They exaggerate a little.

They stretch the truth.

They're scared to make bold claims.

Meanwhile...

The guys making all the money?

They're not lying.

But they ARE making big, bold, audacious claims.

Claims so big they seem unbelievable.

But unlike the Nazis, these claims are TRUE.

And that's the secret:

Don't make small, believable claims that people ignore.

Make big, outrageous claims that are actually TRUE.

That's what I teach in Email Players.

How to make claims so big people HAVE to pay attention.

But back them up with proof so strong they can't help but believe.

Anyway.

That's all for today.

Ben Settle

analysis.opening_hook: Controversial statement guaranteed to get attention
analysis.selling_technique: Problem-solution weave, product as natural solution
analysis.contrarian_angle: Don't be modest with your claims - go big (if true)
